business.headline: India defends antitrust penalty law as Apple risks $38 billion fineThe company fears it could be fined up to $38 billion if the global turnover calculation is used, after a CCI investigation found it had abused its position on its app store. Apple denies the accusations.

Silver falls Rs 12,500, gold prices also easeInvestors remained cautious ahead of important global events, including expected US Supreme Court rulings on Trump-era tariffs and the release of US labour market data.

Who was Agnivesh Agarwal? Vedanta chairman Anil Agarwal's son who dies at 49After completing his studies, Agnivesh went on to establish Fujeirah Gold, which earned a strong reputation in the metals business.

India considers easing curbs on Chinese firms in government contracts: ReportThe curbs have had a significant economic impact, effectively excluding Chinese firms from Indian government projects worth between nearly $700 billion and $750 billion.

Bloodbath on Dalal Street: Sensex ends 780 points lower, Nifty falls below 26,000The Sensex closed 780 points lower, while the Nifty slipped under the psychologically important 26,000 level, reflecting growing investor caution amid mixed global cues and stock-specific pressure in frontline names. The fall was widespread, with most sectoral indices ending in negative territory.

What India's 2025 tax filings reveal about a changing economyIndia's 2025 tax returns offer a rare glimpse into a changing economic mindset. From side businesses to market investments, taxpayers are no longer relying on a single stream of income.

How Venezuela slipped out of India's oil shopping listOnce a strategic crude supplier, Venezuela has slipped to the margins of India's oil imports, showing how sanctions and geopolitics can override commercial logic in global energy trade.

Budget 2026: What do experts want on tax reform, stability and compliance?Budget 2026 just around the corner, hopes are high for reforms that promote growth, compliance, and simplicity in India's tax and business environment.

Sensex closes 780 points lower: 5 reasons why stock market fell todayThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 780.18 points to close at 84,180.96, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 263.90 points to end at 25,876.85. The broader market also closed in the red, reflecting weak sentiment across the board.

Budget 2026: Real estate sector seeks tax relief and policy clarityAs the countdown to Budget 2026 begins, the real estate sector is looking to the government to revisit tax rules and housing definitions to better match today's urban market realities.

New Income Tax rules from April 2026: What will change for taxpayersIndia is set to usher in a new Income Tax law from April 1, 2026. The new Income Tax Act aims to simplify tax rules, improve clarity and make compliance easier for taxpayers in an increasingly digital system.

Promoter families seek Sebi nod on daughters-in-law under takeover rules: ReportOver the past decade, an increasing number of business families have moved promoter holdings, or portions of them, into private family trusts, with family members as beneficiaries.

Why France's generous pension system is becoming an economic burdenWhat was once seen as a pillar of social security is now becoming a growing strain on public finances, as demographic and economic pressures mount.

Thinking of moving abroad? These places charge zero income taxAcross the world, around 19 countries do not charge personal income tax. They are spread across the Middle East, the Caribbean, parts of Europe, and the Pacific.

Vedanta's Anil Agarwal will give away 75% wealth to fulfil dead son's wishWith his son's death, Anil Agarwal says his commitment to give away over 75% of earnings stands firm, signalling a deeper shift toward philanthropy, simpler living, and long-term social investment beyond business success.

Sensex, Nifty open flat as markets ignore fresh US tariff threat; TCS down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 116.63 points to 84,844.51, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 33.70 points to 26,107.05 as of 9:22 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will market open lower after 500% tariff threat from US?Markets have been under pressure for several sessions. The Nifty 50 has slipped 0.7% over the last three trading days, while the BSE Sensex has declined 0.9% during the same period.

Trump bars defence company payouts until weapons production speeds upTrump and senior Pentagon officials have repeatedly criticised major defence companies for failing to deliver weapons and systems at the pace demanded by modern conflicts. They have argued that lengthy delays and ballooning budgets weaken US military readiness and undermine taxpayer confidence.

Darkest day of my life: Vedanta's Anil Agarwal's son dies of cardiac arrest at 49Agarwal's post referenced a longstanding pledge made between father and son to support several social priorities, such as food access, education for children, empowering women, and secure employment for young Indians. Agarwal renewed the promise to devote over 75% of group earnings to initiatives that benefit society.

Union Budget to be presented on Sunday, Feb 1; Economic Survey on Jan 29This will be only the second time the Union Budget will be presented on a Sunday. In 1999, the Budget was presented on a Sunday for the first time.

entertainment.headline: All Her Fault breaks records as Peacock's top original series The limited series All Her Fault, now available on JioHotstar in India, has become Peacock's most-watched original launch. It has amassed 46 million streaming hours in its first three weeks and is maintaining a top-five position among streaming originals, according to Nielsen.

Malavika Mohanan on Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan: I'll miss him on big screen Actor Malavika Mohanan has opened up about her experience of working with Thalapathy Vijay. Ahead of his final film, Jana Nayagan, the actor expressed in an exclusive interview that she will also miss watching him in theatres.

Dhurandhar is not propaganda: Filmmaker Rumi Jaffery shuts down criticism At AajTak's Mumbai Manthan, filmmaker Rumi Jaffery defended Dhurandhar against accusations of being a propaganda film. Headlined by Ranveer Singh, the film has taken the box office by storm.

Deepika-Ranveer pose for selfies at New York City wedding, internet loves it Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh's wedding appearance in New York has gone viral, with fans loving their elegant looks and candid moments during their festive US trip.

Geetu Mohandas on Yash's birthday: A rare fusion of talent and superstardom On the occasion of Yash's birthday, writer-director Geetu Mohandas shared a birthday note. In the post, she offered a glimpse into his creative commitment and their partnership on Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-Ups.

Too hot to acquire? Viral queer romance Heated Rivalry unavailable on Indian OTT The globally viral series, Heated Rivalry, streaming on Prime Video and HBO/Max in several countries, shows up as "unavailable in your location" for Indian viewers. Yet, culturally, the show is very much here.

Will Jana Nayagan be released? Madras High Court order on Vijay's film today The Madras High Court will pronounce an order on Vijay's Jana Nayagan on January 9. Directed by H Vinoth, the film was set for a pan-India release on Friday.

Parul Gulati on Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2 re-release: Our film deserves love Parul Gulati has backed the re-release of Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2 after facing stiff competition from Dhurandhar. She also spoke about sharing the screen space with Kapil Sharma in the movie.

Avika Gor laughs off pregnancy rumours months after wedding: Not true at all Actor Avika Gor has responded to rumours of her pregnancy that circulated online, clarifying that the speculation is unfounded. The actor recently got married to entrepreneur Milind Chandwani.

Prime Video, JioHotstar, SonyLIV, ZEE5: Freedom at Midnight 2, Balti and more OTT platforms have a packed release week with new films and series across Prime Video, JioHotstar, SonyLIV and ZEE5. From Freedom at Midnight Season 2 and The Night Manager Season 2 to fresh thrillers like Weapons and Mask, viewers are spoilt for choice.

After Toxic teaser, RGV calls Geetu Mohandas 'ultimate symbol of women empowerment' The teaser for Yash's upcoming film Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-Ups has sparked major buzz, with filmmakers Ram Gopal Varma and Sandeep Vanga hailing director Geetu Mohandas as a symbol of women empowerment. The dark, stylish thriller is slated for release on March 19, 2026.

Varun Dhawan faces body-shaming as Reddit post alleges paid trolling over Border 2 Varun Dhawan found himself at the centre of a massive trolling wave after Ghar Kab Aaoge from Border 2 went viral. Now, a Reddit post alleging a paid trolling campaign has raised fresh questions about how the backlash against the actor was orchestrated.

Vicky Kaushal's father Sham Kaushal writes heartfelt message for grandson Vihaan Actor Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif have publicly introduced their newborn son as Vihaan Kaushal, prompting a heartfelt response from grandfather Sham Kaushal and an outpouring of affection from fans.

Voice of today's India: Alia Bhatt heaps praises on Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar Bollywood actor Alia Bhatt has joined a growing list of celebrities commending the film Dhurandhar. The Ranveer Singh-starrer has become the highest-grossing Hindi film to date, earning recognition for both its storytelling and performances.

Put all men in jails? Divya Spandana on Supreme Court's can't read dog's mind remark Former MP and actor Divya Spandana has sparked debate by comparing the Supreme Court's concerns on stray dogs to human behaviour on social media. The court highlighted risks posed by stray animals on roads and urged stricter action against non-compliant states.

Netflix this week: De De Pyaar De 2, Taskaree and more Netflix is rolling out a packed slate this week with new films and series across genres, including De De Pyaar De 2, His & Hers and Taskaree: The Smuggler's Web.

When Priyanka Chopra admitted feeling guilty leaving daughter Malti at home Priyanka Chopra has spoken about experiencing "mom's guilt" when work commitments require her to leave her two-year-old daughter, Malti Marie Chopra Jonas, at home.

Sobhita Dhulipala leads new Telugu crime thriller Cheekatilo. Check release date The Prime Original film Cheekatilo, set in Hyderabad and led by Sobhita Dhulipala, will release on Prime Video in India and over 240 countries and territories worldwide on January 23.

Kiara Advani trained with international artists for Cirque-style act in Toxic Kiara Advani prepares for her role as an acrobat in Geetu Mohandas' film Toxic, working with international performers to deliver a visual described as unprecedented in Indian cinema. The film, also starring Yash, is set for release in March 2026.

general news.headline: Cash for loyalty? US floated $10k–$100k plan to woo Greenlanders from DenmarkUS officials have discussed offering lump-sum payments to Greenlanders to try to persuade them to favour a split from Denmark. Figures between $10,000 and $100,000 per head were mentioned during discussions, but no final proposal has been drawn up.

We will hit them very hard: Trump threatens Iran if protesters are killedDonald Trump warned Iran of severe US action if protesters are killed, as economic unrest spreads nationwide and rights groups report at least 45 deaths during ongoing demonstrations.

3 Indians among crew on Russian-flagged oil tanker seized by US: ReportThe Russian-flagged oil tanker 'Marinera' was seized on Wednesday in the North Atlantic after the US forces tracked it from the Caribbean Sea. The US authorities stated that they seized the tanker due to its alleged links to Venezuela.

Mamata Banerjee forcibly removed files: ED vs I-PAC reaches High CourtThe ED said the searches at the residence of I-PAC chief Pratik Jain in Kolkata and the group's office were peaceful till Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee reportedly arrived with a large number of police officers. Read on to find out what happened next.

First Muslim-majority city in US names street after Khaleda ZiaA street in a city in Michigan, the US, has been named after former Bangladeshi Prime Minister Khaleda Zia, who died recently. How a street in Hamtramck was named after Khaleda is a story of the influence of Bangladeshi immigrants in a place that became the US' first Muslim-majority city.

Temperature to dip on Friday, North India to freeze under dense fogNorth India will face severe disruptions due to dense fog and cold waves on January 9. Meanwhile, a deep depression in the Bay of Bengal brings heavy rain to the south.

Will Jana Nayagan be released? Madras High Court order on Vijay's film todayThe Madras High Court will pronounce an order on Vijay's Jana Nayagan on January 9. Directed by H Vinoth, the film was set for a pan-India release on Friday.

Iran hit by nationwide internet blackout after exiled prince calls for mass protestsIran suffered a nationwide internet blackout amid escalating economic protests, with monitoring groups reporting near-zero connectivity as authorities intensified digital censorship during a critical phase of unrest.
Video: Bengaluru man tries to set brother's home on fire, ends up in hospitalAccused Muniraj was enraged with his brother Ramakrishna over a dispute over the proposed sale of an ancestral property.

Energy greed, not narco-terrorism: Venezuelan leader calls out Trump's ambitionDelcy Rodriguez's remarks followed statements by Trump asserting that the US is receiving full cooperation from Venezuela's government and will maintain control over the country and its oil reserves for years. The US president further declared Venezuela was giving "everything that we feel is necessary."

Video: Moment ICE officer shot Minneapolis woman amid immigration crackdownThe Minneapolis shooting incident has triggered a massive controversy in the United States, with fierce protests breaking out in Minneapolis and several other cities.

When Hitler spoke about burning corpses in Benares, and revealed his Nazi viewsA controversial quote attributed to Adolf Hitler mentions cremation rituals at Benares and reveals deep colonial prejudice. Traced to Hitler's Table Talk, we examine what the remark tells us about Nazi ideology, cultural arrogance, and how power viewed non-European societies.

ICE shooting in Minneapolis killed award-winning poet, orphaned 6-year-old sonRenee Nicole Good, a 37-year-old mother of three and award-winning poet, was fatally shot by an ICE agent in Minneapolis during a tense confrontation. Her death, which left her six-year-old son orphaned, has ignited nationwide protests in the US and has raised questions about federal enforcement.

Why a two-day power cut in Berlin amid freezing cold has triggered a terror probeBerlin was plunged into its worst blackout since World War II after an arson attack on high-voltage cables left 45,000 households powerless for two days. This amid sub-zero temperatures in the German capital city. Federal prosecutors have now launched a terrorism probe as far-left group Vulkangruppe claimed responsibility.

Sewer-mixed black water in government pipelines: Delhi taps turn into death trapsContaminated, sewer-mixed water continues to flow through government pipelines while residents fall sick, and authorities respond with the same familiar refrain: work is underway, or fit report from Delhi Jal Board. Delhi has the warnings. Delhi has the documents. Delhi has the evidence. What it lacks is urgency.

Is quiet firing the new way employees are pushed to quit?If you're still on the payroll but no longer in the room, are you still employed? Quiet firing is blurring the line between performance management and forced exits.

What Poland said about India as US turns up heat over Russian oilWe are satisfied, said Poland Foreign Minister Radosaw Sikorski as he backed India as New Delhi faces sharp tariff threats from the US over its continued imports of Russian crude oil.

Fighter jets to help Pak stop taking IMF loans: Khwaja Asif's pants are on firePakistan's Defence Minister, Khwaja Asif, has claimed that Islamabad was getting record orders for fighter jets and might not need IMF's financial assistance after six months. This, he said, came after the four-day mini-war with India. Saudi Arabia, for one, is considering a jets-for-loan deal. Here's a look at Pakistan's public debt and liabilities vis-a-vis Asif's claim.

Meet Mukesh Mandal, software engineer who works as sweeper in Russia to earn Rs 1 lakhMukesh Mandal, a 26-year-old software engineer from India, is now working as a street cleaner in St. Petersburg, earning nearly Rs 1 lakh a month. He was reportedly recruited by a Russian road maintenance company amid a labour shortage in the country.

Tilak Varma discharged from hospital after surgery, ruled out of first 3 NZ T20IsTilak Varma has been discharged from hospital after successful surgery and will miss the first three T20Is against New Zealand, with his availability for the final two matches dependent on his recovery.

Jana Nayagan row: Congress alleges attack on freedom, BJP recalls Indira Gandhi's eraCongress leaders raise concerns about freedom of expression after CBFC withholds certification for Vijay-starrer Jana Nayagan. Hitting back at the Congress, senior BJP leader Tamilsai Soundarajan said that "blaming the central government and the Prime Minister for the film Jananaayagan not receiving a censor certificate" was misleading the public.

Disability didn't stop him: IIT Roorkee grad, startup founder, swimming championSaurav Kumar, a recent IIT Roorkee graduate with a lower-limb disability, has emerged as a national para swimming star after learning the sport just months ago. His journey from personal loss to international competition is redefining resilience, inclusion, and student excellence on Indian campuses.

Order, bulldozers, protest: How Turkman Gate demolition drive unfolded in DelhiFollowing court-ordered demolition near Delhi's Turkman Gate, clashes erupted between locals and police. The area is now under heavy security as police identify suspects in the violence. Stakeholders have called for further legal action and investigation.

sports.headline: Tilak Varma issues injury update following surgery: On the road to recovery India batter Tilak Varma has reassured the fans that he will be back on the field quickly after undergoing surgery earlier in the week. Tilak will head back to Hyderabad on Friday, January 9 and start his rehabilitation process.

Tata Steel Chess: Viswanathan Anand, Nihal Sarin share lead after six rounds Viswanathan Anand and Nihal Sarin finished day two of the Tata Steel Chess India Rapid on top of the Open standings after six rounds, both accumulating 4.5 points. In the women's category, Kateryna Lagno maintained a clear lead with 4.5 points, while Indian participants faced mixed results across the leaderboard.

Vijay Hazare Trophy Roundup: Delhi, Punjab, Vidarbha and UP book quarterfinal spots Delhi, Punjab, Vidarbha and Uttar Pradesh booked Vijay Hazare Trophy quarterfinal spots as big wins and late drama marked a gripping end to the league stage across multiple groups.

Atiqa Mir shines on junior S125 debut with historic top-five finish at Abu Dhabi Eleven-year-old Atiqa Mir delivered a stunning junior S125 debut, finishing fifth at Yas Marina to become the first Indian and first female to achieve a top-five finish on debut in IAME UAE history.

Smriti's message for youngsters in WPL: Performances can open doors to T20 World Cup Smriti Mandhana said strong performances in the WPL can open doors to India selection, stressing that young players with standout seasons will be in contention for the Women's T20 World Cup.

Former Mizoram Ranji Trophy cricketer dies after collapsing during match K Lalremruata, a former Mizoram Ranji Trophy cricketer, passed away after collapsing during a local tournament match, leading to the cancellation of all scheduled cricket matches as a mark of respect.

WPL 2026: Squads, schedule, live streaming details and more The Women's Premier League is all set for its fourth season with the teams ready to battle it out for the crown. Here's all you need to know about the new campaign, which will begin on January 9.

Pakistan Super League expands with Sialkot, Hyderabad sold for record prices The Pakistan Super League took a major step towards expansion on Thursday, with two new franchises sold at record prices at an auction on Thursday, confirming an eight-team league from the 11th edition onward.

Smith, Starc's BBL return: Sydney Sixers player jokes he may lose starting spot Sydney Sixers star Joel Davies joked that he may be axed when Steve Smith and Mitchell Starc return to the team for the remainder of the Big Bash League 2026. Smith and Starc said that they will turn up for the Sixers after the Ashes win.

MP's Noor Ahmed? SRH new recruit Shivang Kumar spins a web in Vijay Hazare Trophy Vijay Hazare Trophy: 23-year-old Shivang Kumar, playing for Madhya Pradesh, is impressing with his left-arm wrist-spin and big-hitting ability. On Thursday, the SunRisers Hyderabad new recruit picked up his maiden five-wicket haul in their win over Karnataka in Ahmedabad.

Delhi Capitals' Auqib Nabi hits maiden hundred as J&K stun HyderabadFresh off becoming a prized recruit for Delhi Capitals, Auqib Nabi produced one of the finest knocks of his List-A career, guiding Jammu and Kashmir to a stunning three-wicket win over Hyderabad in the Vijay Hazare Trophy.

Harry Brook's nightclub incident doesn't surprise Vaughan: England have been looseMichael Vaughan said that he wasn't surprised to hear about Harry Brook's nightclub incident ahead of the New Zealand tour. Vaughan said that England have been loose both on and off the field in recent times after losing the Ashes 1-4.

Has she ever played tennis? Egyptian player's bizarre professional debut goes viralThe lopsided match at a Nairobi ITF tournament, featuring Egyptian wildcard Hajar Abdelkader, who won just three points, has sparked global debate over professional standards, wildcard scrutiny and competitive integrity in lower-tier tennis events.

No champagne showers: Australia give Khawaja final tribute during Ashes celebrationThere were no champagne showers during the Ashes trophy celebrations as the Australian team gave a perfect tribute to the retiring Usman Khawaja after the SCG Test on Thursday, January 8.

Malaysia Open: PV Sindhu, Satwik-Chirag reach quarterfinals, men's singles run endsPV Sindhu and men's doubles pair Satwiksairaj Rankireddy-Chirag Shetty advanced to the quarterfinals of the Malaysia Open Super 1000, while India's men's singles campaign came to an end.

ICC Player of the Month: Shafali Verma named, no Indian shortlisted for men's awardYoung opener Shafali Verma is the only Indian cricketer nominated by the ICC for the Women's Player of the Month award for December 2025, with no Indian representation among the men's nominees.

Babar Azam gets fiery send-off by Marcus Stoinis after yet another BBL flop: WatchBabar Azam's struggles in the BBL continued as Marcus Stoinis trapped him lbw during a low-scoring clash at the MCG, though Sydney Sixers cruised to a six-wicket win over Melbourne Stars.

Former India batting coach becomes consultant for Sri Lanka ahead of T20 World CupSri Lanka cricket have appointed former India coach Vikram Rathour as their new batting consultant for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026. Rathour was part of the Indian backroom staff when they won the T20 World Cup in 2024.

Strong SA20 season could open T20 World Cup door for Tristan Stubbs, says JP DuminyJP Duminy views Tristan Stubbs' exclusion from South Africa's T20 World Cup squad as a chance for growth, highlighting his leadership qualities and the potential for a late call-up through strong domestic performances.

Kohli's brother lashes out at critics after Manjrekar's take on Test retirementVirat Kohli's brother has slammed the Indian star's critics after the recent comments made by Sanjay Manjrekar about the batter quitting Test cricket and not fighting to turn his form around in the longest format of the game.

Sack Brendon McCullum, he is like a gambler who can't change: Geoffrey BoycottAshes 2025-26: Geoffrey Boycott offered a stinging assessment of Brendon McCullum, Ben Stokes, and Rob Key after England's 4-1 loss, questioning the team's philosophy, accountability, and future direction. England lost the series finale by 5 wickets in Sydney on Thursday, January 8.

Brook was punched by a nightclub bouncer, nearly sacked as ODI captain: ReportEngland vice-captain Harry Brook was reportedly close to being sacked on the eve of the Ashes after being struck by a nightclub bouncer while intoxicated, the night before the third ODI against New Zealand in Wellington on November 1.

Hardik Pandya continues Vijay Hazare onslaught, hits 9 sixes vs ChandigarhHardik Pandya is on a tear in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. The Baroda all-rounder smashed nine sixes in a 31-ball 75, continuing a blistering run that has made him the tournament's consistent big hitter.

Sarfaraz slams fastest fifty in Vijay Hazare, hits Abhishek Sharma for 30 runsSarfaraz Khan broke the fastest half century record in Vijay Hazare Trophy scoring 50 in 15 balls. His aggressive innings sets a new benchmark and boosts Mumbai's chances in the tournament.

Dropped from NZ ODIs, Ruturaj Gaikwad replies with record-equalling Vijay Hazare 100Ruturaj Gaikwad struck a record-equalling 15th Vijay Hazare Trophy century for Maharashtra on Thursday. The knock came days after he was dropped from India's ODI squad for the upcoming New Zealand series.

Stokes and McCullum to be sacked? England launch thorough review of Ashes defeatThe ECB has launched a detailed review following England's 1–4 Ashes loss in Australia. England managed to win just one Test during the tour, raising questions about the tactics of captain Ben Stokes and head coach Brendon McCullum.

Shaheen Afridi accuses India of violating sportsmanship, fires World Cup warningPakistan fast bowler Shaheen Afridi has accused India of violating the spirit of sportsmanship during Asia Cup 2025 matches. India and Pakistan players didn't shake hands during the entire Asia Cup and were even involved in heated verbal battles.

Ben Stokes hints at the end of Bazball after Ashes defeat: Teams have cracked itBen Stokes admitted teams have worked out England's Bazball approach after their 4–1 Ashes loss. Following the Sydney Test defeat, the captain hinted at a rethink rather than blind commitment to aggression.

Australia's Steve Smith unsure if he will play in 2027 Ashes in EnglandSteve Smith has cast doubt on his availability for the 2027 Ashes in England after Australia's ageing but resilient squad sealed a dominant 4-1 series victory in the home campaign.

ISL restarts, but players bear the cost: How pay cut demands spell a fresh crisisThe ISL will restart on February 14, but players are being asked to take salary cuts of up to 25 percent. With no commercial partner in place, footballers are paying the price for survival.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
